sentences.en: A frown is often an intimation of disapproval.
sentences.cn: 皱眉头常常表示不赞许.

sentences.en: Every effort is the best excellent intimation. A drop of sweat is the moist opportunity.
sentences.cn: 每一次努力都是最优秀的亲切, 每一滴汗水都是基于的滋润.

sentences.en: He had then not the least intimation of my intention to set up there or anywhere.
sentences.cn: 当时我想在这里或别的地方创业的想法他一点也不知道的.

sentences.en: Hopkins sent me the earliest intimation.
sentences.cn: 霍普金斯最先将情况通知我.

sentences.en: I did not have any intimation that he was going to resign.
sentences.cn: 我没发现任何他要辞职的暗示。

sentences.en: Mrs. Reynolds's respect for Elizabeth seemed to increase on this intimation of her knowing her master.
sentences.cn: 雷诺奶奶听到伊丽莎白跟她主人相熟,便好象益发敬重她.

sentences.en: Still he had a strange prescience , an intimation of something yet to come.
sentences.cn: 不过他有一种奇特的预感, 感到了某件事情就要发生!

sentences.en: The flames rising over the city gave to Aeneas some intimation of the fatal event.
sentences.cn: 城市上空升起的火焰多少向埃涅阿斯暗示了不祥的事件.

sentences.en: The wily Edomite was aroused at the intimation of a possible rival.
sentences.cn: 这狡猾的以东人敏感地觉察到有政敌兴起的可能,便坐立不安.

sentences.en: This intimation seemed to compose in some degree the vehement passion of the old hag.
sentences.cn: 这番交代似乎使老妖婆的无名怒火稍微平息了一点.

words.tran_cn: 亲密的；私人的；精通的；有性关系的

trans.tran_en: An intimation is an indirect suggestion or sign that something is likely to happen or be true
